comment: 2.25 hops not 3, couldnt change on my phone
split, maybe dry hop one and cocoa nib one
1 hr and 20 min temp was at 146

lost about 2 degrees per hour on the overnight mash (average, faster at first then slowly lost). brought 10 gal sparge water up to near boil and added to a near filled mash, stirred a lot and let it settle back down, temp after that was: still way low. ended up having to sparge off 12+ gallons, in for a long boil! total boil time: 4.5 hours. ended up with 7.5 gallons of 1.098 wort. was supposed t 5.5 gallons of 1.108, more to play with, may oak some, chocolate some, coffee some, leave some as is. bottle and age! vanilla some?
mashed in for an overnight mash at 152, left out the roasted barley and black malt. will add during sparge tomorrow.

The imperial stout finished out at 1.014 on S04, actually a bit lower than I would have liked, smelled fruity, a bit smoky, tasted roasty, fruity raisiny, and finished with dark chocolate. See you next winter my dangerous, tasty friend. #delish
too much 120 and black malt, and/or the LONG boil really brought those out. not sure, but will take those down a notch next time (cut in half). maybe chocolate up.
